body:
Lisa Geiger is a Wisconsin artist who exhibited artistic talent as a youth and always enjoyed working in creative mediums whether graphite, colored pencils, oil painting, pastels, watercolors, or the culinary arts.  Lisa has always perceived and appreciated the beauty in things whether it’s her surroundings or food.  Light, shadow, color, texture, and composition are careful considerations in her artwork. Now that her youngest child has gone off to college, she spends more time honing her craft, particularly oils, water colors and pastels. She works tirelessly and reads voraciously. She also attends classes taught by nationally renowned artists Joyce Hicks, Doug Dawson, Lois Griffel, Lee Mothes and David Cheifetz, among others, to challenge her abilities and to continue to improve her skills.  Lisa’s works have been accepted for exhibition at Wisconsin art venues. Lisa has painted scenes of Pennsylvania on her visits here and provides this description, "Appalachian Foothills dressed in greens are a calming back-drop for the spectacle of colored grasses." 

High auction record for this artist is $10,080.
dimensions: Oil on Board, 15.5 x 19.5 inches/Signed lower left
metaTitle: Lisa Geiger - Appalachian Foothills Painting For Sale
metaDescription: Lisa Geiger, American 20th And 21st Century Painter - Appalachian Foothills Painting For Sale - Oil On Board, 15.5x19.5 Inches - Signed Lower Left.
title: Appalachian Foothills
